item.description:
I will go on this hike, and gee since im a few hundred feet from the water for a few hours, all hot, sweaty and in desire for a good paddle afterward..might as well bring the yaks...


Here is the hike info:
Your Assistant Organizer, Kevin S, sent the following message
to the members of The Hartford Area Hiking Meetup Group:

Announcing a new event for The Hartford Area Hiking Meetup
Group!

What: Hike at Mansfield Hollow SP in Mansfield CT

When: Saturday, July 8, 10:00 AM

Where: Click the link below to find out!

Event Description: This is a roughly 5 mile hike with water
views in Mansfield Hollow State Park around the northern end of
Mansfield Hollow Lake. We will follow the blue blazed trail
that circles the lake. There are two spots of only about .1
mile each where we will have to walk on the shoulder of a road
but this should not be an issue.

We will meet at the park at 10 AM at the northwestern parking
area off of Rte. 89. Then we will hike in a clockwise direction
around the lake. The hike should last about 2.75 hrs. at a
leasurly pace and be over by about 12:45 PM.

The group has the option of stopping someplace in Mansfield
Center or Storrs for lunch.

The leader on this one is Kevin S (
http://hiking.meetup....) so please direct
questions on this event to him.

Learn more and RSVP here:
http://hiking.meetup....


If you dont want to do the hike or timing cant let you..why not join in for the lunch after the hike..
Meet some of the hikers, maybe some hikers will kayak or yak in the water later also..I dont know when lunch will be done so i guessed at the start time..

The water area has 3 rivers feeding in, all of which have explorative properties. There are interesting islands and coves to also checkout. The lake is divided by Bassetts Bridge into a small area and a larger area.
Clean water too...

Getting There:
Mansfield Hollow Boat Launch:
I see the hike is at a slightly different parking location, but we will hike past it from the description.

From I-84, south on rte 195 through Storrs to Mansfield ctr
Go 0.5 mile past rte 89 junction and turn left onto Bassset Bridge rd at the stoplight, should see Mansfield Hollow Park sign.
Will see a picknick area on left go a bit further apx 0.5 miles to the access right before the bridge on the left.

From I-384, follow rte 6 to toward Willimantic.
6 and 66 will intersect at a light. Take a left on to 6.
Follow ths highway to the second exit, go straight (=rte633 or s. frontage rd.) it is acually a parallel to rte6 connector to rte 195,
Signs for UCONN should be there somewhere too,
Go north on rte 195 toward UCONN for about 2 miles then turn right at the onto Basset Bridge Rd, same info from here as above.

I have the blue Toyota Avalon with the 2 kayaks on a old sailboat trailer. Yeh one kayak with a 55 horsepower motor on it and a torpedo prop...
The RedNeck Jet....runs on pure moonshine...

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: CrossList and Yaking in the Mansfield Hollow
